Tanya Shreedhar

Postdoctoral Researcher, University of Edinburgh, UK

Room 1.25

Informatics Forum

10 Crichton Street

Edinburgh, EH8 9AB

Scotland, UK

I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Informatics at the University of Edinburgh. I am currently a part of the NetSys group under the guidance of Prof. Mahesh Marina. I received my PhD from IIIT-Delhi, India in 2022 under the supervision of Dr. Sanjit K. Kaul. I was also a visiting researcher at the Chair of Connected Mobility at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) in 2020 working with Prof. Dr.-Ing Jörg Ott. Before joining my PhD, I did my Bachelor in Engineering and received an academic gold medal from Panjab University, Chandigarh, India.

My research interests lie broadly in the area of networks and systems. I work in the area of next-generation transport protocols, specifically but not limited to MultiPath TCP, QUIC and Age Control Protocol. My current research includes working on wireless and mobile systems with a focus on data-driven networking. Additionally, I enjoy working on problems in edge/cloud computing, Internet measurements and emerging Internet applications.

News

Oct 2023 I moderated the Panel discussion on “First Steps to Future Success: A Panel for New Grad Students” at the ACM S3 Workshop at Mobicom 2023.
Sep 2023 I was the Master of Ceremonies for Heidelberg Laureate Forum (HLF) 2023!
Sep 2023 I am serving on the TPC of Passive and Active Measurement Conference (PAM) 2024. Please consider submitting your cool measurement works there!
Jul 2023 I presented my research on “A Longitudnal Study on MPTCP Adoption in the Wild” at Multi-Service Networks workshop (Coseners 2023!
May 2023 I am co-organizing the PerFail Workshop 2024 co-located with PerCom 2024.
